title: I dunno how to respond to
body:
I got a chat restriction but in the chat logs all it lists is my comments, it does not show what i was responding to any potential harassment or trolling i endured it just shows me responding to it or ranting? Even if i agreed that my behavior was inexcusably horrible which i do not, i have a much harder time figuring out where i went wrong without the context of each game.

I looked at some of the chat logs from others in these forums and they have people cussing others out and insulting them with really harsh words. I didn't do that. I like to think in most of my games I'm nice and help out my team but apparently that doesn't matter if you ever mess up. What does matter is your mistakes not your accomplishments. I find it odd that a system is in place that will punish you if you make a few mistakes without taking any of the good you do into account.

I would like to mention in every game in that log i was antagonized, trolled, or harassed for a good portion or all game. It becomes very frustrating when you are trying to learn this game and because most of the others you are matched with are smurfing they just leave the game when its not easy cause its just a a smurf. It is also frustrating as a new player when you are yelled at and harassed by 4 other players for not being a "challenger smurf". I may have to post the chat logs in more than one post as i do not know if there is a character limit on this so if i double or triple post and that upsets you i apologize.

I do understand that calling someone stupid or an idiot or threatening to make someone lose is not ok. But at the same time unless you are doing it all the time getting frustrated a few times should not get you punished. Any system that demands perfection is not a good system.

I would be happy to try and provide context to the best of my memory for any questions that anyone has.

EDIT: I am a new player yelled at constantly i have played like 30-40 total games and i think in two of them i haven't been harassed simply for being new. For not knowing everything, and being a "challenger" smurf like them. The second i get fed up with being told how shit i am and tell others to stuff it i get punished. No wonder 99 percent of new players are called smurfs, like 99 percent of actual new players are never gonna play this game to the point where they get good let alone max level why would anyone put up with a game that promotes punishing victims. I have never seen a community who would literally watch as someone was verbally abused over and over and then call the victim a monster who should be punished for standing up for themselves. Nowhere else anywhere besides this community have i seen so many people so detached from reality. Every single person here who has said no matter how much you are harassed you are not allowed to defend yourself is a terrible person. In a court of law,  if you get attacked and defend yourself, you will not get punished because in REALITY, not your safe space, you cant be a dick to someone then complain when you get called one. I bet you all think its absolutely terrible when a thief breaks into someones home and gets shot, when a rapist is beaten by their victim, when a parent abuses their child and the child defends themselves and the victim who rose above their attacker should rot in jail. You are all monsters. Wow no wonder this community is considered one of the worst of any game. I though it was just because it was full of raging assholes! But no you people are why this community is so very bad, you are worse than the people insulting others. You are the reason real progress and improvement cannot exist. You would rather blame victims instead of finding the reason there are so many and fixing THAT problem. Why are so many people harassing others is what should change not people defending themselves.

I mean people aren't robots and i think if I'm harassed nonstop then i shouldn't be expected to just pretend it is not happening.  Are you gonna tell a victim being yelled at by a random stranger on the street to just pretend its not happening? Would you applaud them for standing up for themselves?

If the waiter is rude to you, you don't set the store on fire in response. You refuse a tip and report them to the manager if it was really bad.

Note that there is a difference between "Hey--Sorry to bother you, but this isn't what I ordered" and "You idiot. Shut up and bring me the right food. Geez. Come on, moron."

In this case you are too often doing the equivalent of the latter, which is NOT something you're entitled to do. Or, more accurately, you're free to do it, and Riot is free to say that's not acceptable behavior and restrict you for it.

The 10-game chat restriction is your friendly warning though. Would a "hey, a player reported you in your last game. Consider taking a second glance at your behavior to see if it was appropriate" be nice? Sure! I'd be okay with that being implemented.

However, the important thing here is that you fought back -- it's not getting harassed for 20 minutes and then put in jail. It's more like getting a drunk guy up in your face at a bar for 10 minutes, and then arguing loudly with him and disrupting the other patrons for an additional 10 minutes, and then being surprised when you're both asked to leave by the bouncer. Of *course* you're both asked to leave, since you were both causing a scene. That fact that he started it is immaterial to the bar, since you're both being problematic.

You got a warning. A 10 game chat restriction is literally not even a day for many people (it's summer, a lot of people play 10 games per day, especially ARAM/normal players).

Riot could have given you a full-blown suspension for 14 days. You didn't get sent to jail, you didn't get beat in the face with a nightstick, you got a **warning**. 

If you're speeding behind someone and the cop pulls you over, you can't claim "but he was doing it too". You got caught, and given a warning, and it's not a valid excuse that you didn't know the speed limit or that you were just following what others do.

I've been playing this game since season 2, and I've gotten frustrated at people myself over the years. However, when I get frustrated I just yell and rage at the screen instead of in the chat (in other words I don't take it out on my teammates). I've also had some arguments/disagreements with people in-game but I don't resort to things like insults or name-calling or trolling. If possible I may try to diffuse the situation but otherwise If I see that someone has no interest in behaving respectfully then I just mute them* and if need be report them as well. Because of this I have never received a warning or a punishment of any kind.

Again you don't have to be perfect, you just have to not be a jerk and try to keep a neutral or positive attitude as best you can, and if all else fails you could always just mute all at the start of the match so that you're not tempted to fight back whenever someone says something that you don't like. Basically as long as you're making sure that the behavior of constantly arguing and fighting with teammates doesn't become the norm for you then you should be fine.

*Like many others I don't like muting people myself on the off chance of someone having something actually important to say, but sometimes it is just better to mute than risk exposing yourself to even more distractions in the game than there already are.
